main event: A member of the Army Air Forces intelligence staff reported a sighting in Hoffesville, Pennsylvania, on March 21, 1950.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 5 minutes,The object was observed as a very bright light that appeared to flash on and off for 3 hours over 4 consecutive nights,No aircraft was scrambled to intercept the object,The object was thought to be an airplane initially but was later considered a strange object,The object was observed at approximately 522 ft altitude.
sighted object: a strange object in the air
witness description: a member of the Army Air Forces intelligence staff
